description:
'''Skeeter Davis''' (born '''Mary Frances Penick'''; December 30, 1931{{spaced en dash}}September 19, 2004) was an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter who sang [[Crossover (music)|crossover]] pop music songs including 1962's "[[The End of the World (Skeeter Davis song)|The End of the World]]". She started out as part of [[The Davis Sisters (country)|the Davis Sisters]] as a teenager in the late 1940s, eventually recording for [[RCA Victor]]. In the late 1950s, she became a solo star.

One of the first women to achieve major stardom in the country music field as a solo vocalist, she was an acknowledged influence on [[Tammy Wynette]] and [[Dolly Parton]] and was hailed as an "extraordinary country/pop singer" by ''[[The New York Times]]'' music critic [[Robert Palmer (American writer)|Robert Palmer]].
